title: 7 Best Zip Lines in Wales
metaDescription: The best zip lines in Wales ranked. From the world's fastest (Velocity) to family-friendly forest runs — honest reviews, prices, and booking tips.
strapline: The world's fastest zip line is here. So are six more worth screaming about.
heroAlt: Person on the Velocity zip line at Zip World Penrhyn Quarry flying over the vast quarry
introduction:
Wales has more world-class zip lines per capita than any country on earth. That's not a joke — Zip World alone operates the fastest zip line in the world and the longest in Europe, both in North Wales.

But it's not just about Zip World. From family-friendly forest runs to genuine 100mph+ experiences over flooded quarries, Wales has zip line experiences for every age and adrenaline threshold. Most are concentrated in and around Snowdonia, taking advantage of the dramatic quarry landscapes and mountain terrain.

This list covers dedicated zip line experiences, not zip wires that are part of adventure parks. Prices range from £20 to £75 per person. Book in advance for summer weekends — the popular ones sell out weeks ahead.
rankingCriteria: We've ridden all of these zip lines. Rankings factor in speed/thrill factor, scenery, the overall experience (from booking to landing), and value for money. We also consider whether the experience lives up to the marketing.

longTail: fastest zip line in the world wales

entries.name: Zip World Velocity
entries.verdict: The fastest zip line in the world. 100mph over a flooded quarry. It lives up to the hype.
entries.imageAlt: Zip World Velocity wire stretching across the vast Penrhyn Quarry with a rider visible
entries.whyItMadeTheList: Velocity is the headliner — the fastest zip line in the world and the longest in Europe at 1.5km. You fly prone (Superman-style) at speeds up to 125mph over the cavernous Penrhyn Quarry near Bethesda. The scale is breathtaking — the quarry is genuinely vast, the drop below you real, and the speed incomprehensible until you experience it. The whole package — the briefing, the walk to the launch platform, the view, the ride — is world-class.
entries.bestFor: Adrenaline seekers wanting a genuine world-record experience
entries.skipIf: You have a serious fear of heights or weigh over 120kg (weight limits apply). The ride itself is very short for the price — you're paying for the experience, not the minutes.
entries.insiderTip: Book the first slot of the day for the best chance of clear weather and the shortest queues. The 'Little Zipper' practice line (included) goes first — it's 500m and gives you a feel for it before the main event. Weekday mornings are quietest. The quarry café is decent.

parking.location: Zip World Penrhyn Quarry car park
parking.notes: Large car park at the site. Signed from Bethesda on the A5.

entries.guidedOption: Book directly at zipworld.co.uk. From £65pp. Advance booking essential.

entries.name: Zip World Titan
entries.verdict: Four people, four wires, racing side-by-side across a quarry. The most fun zip line in Wales.
entries.imageAlt: Four riders racing on parallel zip wires at Zip World Titan
entries.whyItMadeTheList: If Velocity is the solo thrill, Titan is the group experience. Four parallel zip wires let you race side-by-side across the dramatic Llechwedd slate mine near Blaenau Ffestiniog. The course has multiple stages, each getting progressively bigger and faster. It's less about raw speed than Velocity and more about shared experience — screaming alongside friends while flying over quarry lakes. The mining heritage backdrop adds genuine atmosphere.
entries.bestFor: Groups of friends, families (age 7+), stag/hen parties, team-building
entries.skipIf: You want the fastest zip line — that's Velocity. Titan is about fun, not records.
entries.insiderTip: Go as a group of four for the full racing experience. The underground section at Llechwedd (Zip World Caverns, separate ticket) is also excellent — combine for a full day. Book both activities for a discount.

parking.notes: At Llechwedd Slate Caverns, Blaenau Ffestiniog. Well-signed.

entries.name: Zip World Fforest Coaster & Zip
entries.verdict: The best zip line experience for families — forest setting, multiple activities, and accessible thrills.
entries.imageAlt: Child on a zip wire through forest canopy at Zip World Fforest
entries.whyItMadeTheList: Zip World Fforest near Betws-y-Coed is designed for families and those who want adventure without the extreme factor. The zip lines run through beautiful forest canopy, and the site includes the Fforest Coaster (an alpine-style toboggan run) and Treetop Nets. The whole package makes it a full-day family adventure. The zip lines themselves are fun rather than terrifying — perfect for kids and adults who are nervous about Velocity-level thrills.
entries.difficulty: Easy (age 3+ for some activities, 7+ for zip lines)
entries.bestFor: Families with children, groups wanting multiple activities, anyone wanting gentle thrills
entries.skipIf: You want adrenaline — this is the family-friendly option. Velocity and Titan deliver more raw excitement.
entries.insiderTip: The Fforest Coaster is actually more fun than the zip lines for most kids — it's a gravity-powered alpine coaster through the trees and you control the speed. Book the combo ticket for zip line + coaster for best value. The café on site is good.

parking.notes: Off the A470 near Betws-y-Coed. Easy to find.

entries.guidedOption: Book at zipworld.co.uk. From £20pp for individual activities.

entries.name: Zip World Caverns
entries.verdict: Zip lines UNDERGROUND. Fly through Britain's largest zip line cavern in the dark.
entries.imageAlt: Illuminated underground cavern at Zip World Caverns with zip wires visible
entries.whyItMadeTheList: Zip World Caverns takes the zip line concept underground into the massive Llechwedd slate mines. Multiple zip lines, via ferrata bridges, and rope challenges run through illuminated caverns deep beneath the mountain. It's atmospheric, unusual, and unlike any other zip line experience in the world. The scale of the underground chambers is genuinely awe-inspiring. This is the most unique entry on the list.
entries.bestFor: Anyone wanting a unique adventure experience. Perfect for rainy days (it's underground!).
entries.skipIf: You're claustrophobic. The caverns are large but you are underground. Also the scrambling/climbing elements may not suit everyone.
entries.insiderTip: This is the best rainy-day activity in Snowdonia — it's underground so weather is irrelevant. Combine with Titan (same site) for a full day. Wear warm layers — the caverns are cold year-round (around 10°C).

parking.notes: Same site as Titan. At Llechwedd Slate Caverns, Blaenau Ffestiniog.

entries.name: Go Below Underground Adventures
entries.verdict: Not just zip lines — a full underground adventure including the deepest zip line in the world.
entries.imageAlt: Adventurers traversing underground at Go Below with headlamps illuminating the mine
entries.whyItMadeTheList: Go Below operates in abandoned mines near Betws-y-Coed and offers a more hardcore underground adventure than Zip World Caverns. Their 'Ultimate Xtreme' trip includes what they claim is the deepest underground zip line in the world (1,300ft below the surface), plus abseiling, caving, via ferrata, and an underground boat ride. It's more physically demanding and more adventurous than the Zip World offerings — closer to caving meets zip-lining.
entries.difficulty: Challenging (physical fitness and some courage required)
entries.bestFor: Adventure seekers who want more than just a zip line. The full underground experience.
entries.skipIf: You're claustrophobic, have mobility issues, or just want a quick zip line — Go Below is a full-day commitment.
entries.insiderTip: Book the 'Challenge' trip as a minimum — the 'Xtreme' and 'Ultimate Xtreme' are the really memorable experiences. You'll get dirty, wet, and tired. Bring a change of clothes. They provide overalls, helmets, and headlamps.

parking.location: Go Below meeting point (varies by trip)
parking.notes: Meeting point details provided on booking. Usually near Betws-y-Coed or Conwy Valley.

entries.guidedOption: All trips are guided. Book at gobelow.co.uk. From £55pp.

entries.name: TreeTop Adventure (Betws-y-Coed)
entries.verdict: High ropes and zip lines through forest canopy. The best tree-based adventure in North Wales.
entries.imageAlt: Participant on a high rope course through trees at TreeTop Adventure
entries.whyItMadeTheList: TreeTop Adventure offers high ropes courses and zip lines through the forest canopy near Betws-y-Coed. It's not as fast or dramatic as the Zip World experiences, but the treetop setting is beautiful and the combination of climbing, balancing, and zipping makes it a more varied adventure. There are courses for different ages and abilities, from gentle junior courses to challenging adult routes with big zip finishes.
entries.bestFor: Families wanting a multi-element adventure, groups wanting team challenges
entries.skipIf: You want pure zip line speed — this is more about the overall treetop experience.
entries.insiderTip: The 'Pine' course is the longest and most challenging for adults. Book online for discounts. The nearby Fairy Glen (a short walk from the site) is a stunning gorge worth visiting before or after.

entries.name: Zip World Tower (Hirael Bay, Bangor)
entries.verdict: A new addition — zip from a tower on the coast with views across the Menai Strait.
entries.imageAlt: Zip World Tower at Hirael Bay with the Menai Strait and Anglesey visible behind
entries.whyItMadeTheList: Zip World's newest venture in Bangor offers zip lines from a purpose-built tower overlooking the Menai Strait and Anglesey. It's a shorter, more accessible experience than Velocity but the coastal setting is unique — you zip with sea views rather than quarry views. Being in Bangor makes it the most convenient zip line for anyone visiting Anglesey or the northern Snowdonia coast.
entries.bestFor: Visitors to Bangor/Anglesey wanting a quick zip line experience, families
entries.skipIf: You want the big quarry/underground experiences — this is more of a taster.
entries.insiderTip: Good as a warm-up before graduating to Velocity if you're nervous about the bigger experience. The views to Anglesey and the Menai Strait are stunning. Combine with a visit to Bangor Pier and the Blue Sky café on the waterfront.

parking.notes: On the Bangor waterfront. Easy access from the A5/A55.

startPoint.name: Zip World Tower, Hirael Bay, Bangor

spring.note: Quieter booking slots, spring weather, avoid summer prices

summer.note: Book weeks in advance — summer sells out fast

autumn.note: Underground options perfect for autumn weather. Forest colours at Fforest

winter.note: Underground experiences are weather-proof. Velocity runs year-round but cancels in high wind

faqs.question: What's the fastest zip line in Wales?
faqs.answer: Zip World Velocity (#1) at Penrhyn Quarry near Bethesda. It's the fastest zip line in the world, reaching speeds up to 125mph. The wire is 1.5km long and you fly prone (Superman-style) over the quarry. Costs £65-75pp.

faqs.question: Are zip lines in Wales suitable for children?
faqs.answer: Yes — Zip World Fforest (#3) accepts children from age 3 for some activities. Titan (#2) takes children from age 7. Velocity (#1) has a minimum age of 10 and weight/height restrictions. TreeTop Adventure (#6) has junior courses from age 3.

faqs.question: Do zip lines run in the rain in Wales?
faqs.answer: Yes, mostly. Outdoor zip lines like Velocity run in rain but cancel in high winds or electrical storms. Underground experiences (Caverns #4, Go Below #5) are completely weather-proof. Rain actually makes Velocity more atmospheric. Book flexible dates in winter.

faqs.question: How much does Zip World Velocity cost?
faqs.answer: £65-75 per person depending on the day and time slot. This includes the Little Zipper practice line and the main Velocity line. The ride itself takes about 1 minute, but the total experience is about 2 hours. Book in advance — it sells out in peak season.
